An excellent game, and more than worth the $1 (though I read back in 2015 you'd make it free after open beta?). Definitely one of the best, if not the best, RPG on the play store. However, it isn't perfect; the game is horribly unbalnced (mainly due to the random nature of events). One playthrough you can have gold and supplies thrown at you, and others you're fighting endless waves of enemies right outside of town and spending all your gold on injuries. Combat, too, is unbalanced. I'm almost certain it scales off of your level, meaning no matter how strong you get, the enemy is always stronger, dissuading custom builds and almost forcing you to use cookie-cutter tactics. This could use some work. Fix the balancing issues, and it would be a truly legendary game. I plan to get the DLC's as soon as I can afford them, and I'm looking forward to future titles (you should definitely stick with the create-your-own-hero theme). EDIT: I appreciate the human response. Not many developers do that. If I could give one piece of advice though: every battle doesn't need to be an epic struggle against boss-tier enemies. Sometimes it's nice to take on those old easy rats or wolves, especially right outside of town where it wouldn't make sense that there's an army of wyverns and trolls. And it would make it so the player doesn't feel like they're on a treadmill making no progress unless they resort to cheese "tactics". Save the difficult encounters for dungeons, guild requests (why is there a request to take down wolves or goblins when there's wyverns at the gates?) And wildernesses (the middle of those long stretches between distant towns). Just my suggestion; it would make battles less of a chore and would reward builds other than the cookie cutter one.

content: I'm going to start by saying this game IS WORTH THE DOLLAR. buy it try it very well written it's fun to read through. If this was a choose-your-own-adventure game easy five star. I use blessed curse case I match the proper elements to the proper monster, and yet at this point Random Encounters kill my entire party with ease. Gold is so scarce you have to choose between training skills or better equipment or having enough transportation for food drink and required first.  I spent the last 4 hours going from place to place trying to locate anything that can help my characters Advanced thinking maybe I just hit a dry spot or rough patch that is not the case. This difficulty by attrition approach to the game makes it almost impossible to enjoy since it already is extremely slow in the sense of its Oregon Trail ask movement which is a great concept if it were not so difficult to actually handle the encounters.  And speaking of encounters the skill system is extremely lopsided in the sense that you barely ever succeed despite having 10 of 10 of your skills which by the way also called build the train and has no chance of increasing unless you pay.  This all adds up to a grinding aspect of the game where you walk back and forth between two cities or between cities with Fighters Guild and Mage guild quests which range from two types laughably easy to Impossible. If that wasn't enough to make it almost unplayable when you actually get to town even a simple trip to the chapel can end in a dragon attack which is an instant party wife since you can't even hit the Dragon because your characters are not ready to fight a dragon. This crawling pace and just terrible system of attrition reloading restarting and basically Forced Gameplay makes me want to delete this game and move on because it is just so disappointing when it started out so promising. I will however give it one more shot and roll a fighter class to allow me to maybe enjoy the game even though it's taking away my choyce I will update and edit this if I find a redeemable and just got a terrible playthrough and it's just the way it is but I feel as though the game is disjointed at best.

content: Little Killerz most ambitious game to date is a masterpiece, and the greatest game I've seen for the android family.  It's an adventure rpg with hours of adventure for each individual play through.  There are six kingdoms to choose from, each with their own character back story and national quests.  Make new enemies and allies each time a shape a group of heroes or villains as you desire.  I have easily clocked 100+ hours on this game already and am still finding new quests and events!

Great continuation of the series with even more replay value!    If you liked the previous chapters (Fallen Knight & Beyond the Iron Wall) you'll really like this one.  I was given the chance to play test it for a couple months, and it's much more expanded than the previous games in the series.  In addition to the choices listed in the description, you also get to choose your moral compass, and even your first skill (so you're not stuck with something you never wanted).    The new characters than can join your party are really interesting and fun, and you can rotate them around or even just drop them all and travel solo (but then you'll get outnumbered a lot).    There's plenty of replay value since you can try new games starting out from each kingdom, and there are often different choices presented  throughout the various jobs and encounters.    As noted, the IAP isn't needed to get through the game, but the add-on quests are fun and easily worth the low price, and the armor/weapon sets are pretty cool too.  But if you don't mind doing things the hard way, you won't need any of them any more than you would have in the previous games (that didn't have them).
Original work with unique protagonist!  Love it!
Long live Vasena! Hours of endless fun I promise you'll love it too.
This game is HUGE! Love the open world approach; it's a fitting but fresh addition (conclusion?) to the series . I don't think I've even fully explored the first two, but they're gonna have to wait!
